DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate functional electrical stimulation ( FES ) device wear low leg effect child ( age 6-17 year ) hemiplegic cerebral palsy walk perform functional activity . The investigator expect find wearing functional electrical stimulation device improve walk functional activity child hemiplegic cerebral palsy . Participants train use device require wear daily 3 month . Each participant evaluate begin intervention complete intervention . This study provide important information regard benefit treatment intervention child hemiplegic cerebral palsy .
DOC.brief_title: Functional Electrical Stimulation Hemiplegic Cerebral Palsy
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis hemiplegic Cerebral Palsy Gross Motor Function Classification System ( GMFCS ) I II Age 617 year inclusive Demonstrate foot drop gait without wear ankle foot orthosis Tolerance neuroprosthesis stimulation Physician referral participate intervention Passive dorsiflexion least neutral knee extend Available travel study visit Ability follow instruction cooperate study protocol Caregiver read understands English Exclusion criterion : Any metal implant contain electrical circuitry Continuous regular use neuroprosthesis stimulation previous study enrollment Previous orthopaedic procedure involve tibialis anterior muscle time Previous orthopaedic procedure affect limb last year Botulinum toxin administer within past 3 month , plan treatment course study Any condition PI feel would limit ambulatory progress ( e.g . arthritis , uncontrolled seizure )
